frameDefinitions: The Authorities put a Prisoner in Prison as punishment for an Offense.
During a court appearance, a Sentence, generally a punishment, is imposed on the Convict by a Court, usually represented by a judge.
An Employer ends an employment relationship with an Employee.
The Authorities hold a Suspect under suspicion of having committed a crime (Charges).
A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.
An Executioner punishes an individual (Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the Reason).
frameExamples: US Drug Researcher <t>Imprisoned</t> for FDA Fraud.
The judge <t>sentenced</t> Martha Stewart to 2 years in prison for insider trading.
He <t>fired</t> me as annotator for being too slow.
The police <t>held</t> Mr. Smith in the slammer on charges of killing his lawyer.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who is confined in a penal institution.
The <fen>Prison</fen>  within which the <fen>Prisoner</fen> comes to be confined.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> are the institution or actors carrying out the imprisonment.
The time when the imprisonment happens.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Prisoner</fen> is kept.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is given a <fen>Sentence</fen> by the <fen>Court</fen>.
The <fen>Court</fen> imposes a <fen>Sentence</fen> on a <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Sentence</fen> is imposed on the <fen>Convict</fen> by the <fen>Court</fen>.
This role denotes the duration of the sentence.
The illegal action of which the <fen>Convict</fen> has been found guilty and for which they are punished.
The Time when the <fen>Convict</fen> is sentenced.
The location of the sentencing <fen>Court</fen>.
The person who is let go by their <fen>Employer</fen>.
The person (or institution) that end an employment relationship with an <fen>Employee</fen>.
The label given to a particular type of employment.

The action that the <fen>Employee</fen> is relieved from doing for the <fen>Employer</fen>

.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an <fen>Employer</fen> fires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Employer</fen> fires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> hold the <fen>Suspect</fen> in custody.
This role identifies the person who is taken into custody and held, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
When the detaining occurs.
Where the detaining takes place.
The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The <fen>Executioner</fen> is the individual who performs the execution.
The <fen>Executed</fen> is the person who is killed by the <fen>Executioner</fen> in retribution for the crime that the <fen>Executed</fen> was convicted of.
When the execution occurs.
Where the execution takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Man</fex> Falsely Imprisoned for 24 Years Seeks Damages
When she returned, <fex>the Chaoyang Town government authorities</fex> imprisoned her for 5 days.
Judge Duncan sentenced <fex>Marty</fex> to five years under house detention.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> sentenced Marty to five years under house detention.
Judge Duncan sentenced Marty <fex>to five years under house detention</fex>.
Tom will recieve a <t>sentence</t> <fex>of five years</fex>.
A pet store owner was sentenced <fex>for illegaly smuggling protected reptiles</fex>.
He will be sentenced <fex>at a later date</fex>.
Biancaniello will be sentenced <fex>in San Francisco</fex> later this summer.
<fex>I</fex> was just fired yesterday!
Dominic Mallozzi claims <fex>United Trust Bank</fex> fired him from a job at the bank's Palmer Township branch because he's HIV positive.
Doc Rivers was fired <fex>as coach of the Orlando Magic</fex>.
I was fired <fex>from training the new actors</fex>.
Guess who just got fired <fex>today</fex>!
The phone in his small apartment in the town of Milan rang and he dreaded it. He was going to be fired <fex>right there</fex>.
<fex>Candlelight</fex> sparkled on the silverware.
Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
The fire <fex><t>glowed</t></fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
The truth is, <fex>we</fex> have all put them to death.
<fex>He</fex> was to be hanged in the morning.
